title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2016 required and existing legislation are being enacted and applied to protect girls and boys in Southside Belize City, Stann Creek and Toledo from violence and abuse, including sexual abuse Justice officials, social workers and police officers are trained on procedures and services for children in contact with the law , and children and families in Belize, Stann Creek and Toledo are accessing targeted birth registration services

mailing-address.narrative: P. O. Box 2672 Belize City Belize Central America

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Children associated with armed forces and armed groups - prevention and response
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016 required and existing legislation are being enacted and applied to protect girls and boys in Southside Belize City, Stann Creek and Toledo from violence and abuse, including sexual abuse; Justice officials, social workers and police officers are trained on procedures and services for children in contact with the law;, and children and families in Belize, Stann Creek and Toledo are accessing targeted birth registration services

description.narrative: The Child Protection Programme continues to address social norms and behaviour that condones violent practices and ensures that impunity does not go unaddressed and unmeasured in the justice system. | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/01/2017

title.narrative: Existence of free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Prosecutors' offices and municipal courts applying child-friendly procedures
Health workers trained on birth registration
Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Number of social service workers in the country
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Protection orders issued by courts for victims of domestic violence effectively implemented by police and other relevant authorities
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Data on most forms violence, exploitation and abuse of children are collected through routine administrative sources
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
Existence of legislation that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Justice system complies with the minimum standards laid down in the Beijing Rules of Justice
